case_vignette: A 93-year-old woman is brought to the physician because of a purple area on her right arm that has been growing for one month. She has not had any pain or itching of the area. She has hyperlipidemia, a history of basal cell carcinoma treated with Mohs surgery 2 years ago, and a history of invasive ductal carcinoma of the right breast treated with radical mastectomy 57 years ago. She has had chronic lymphedema of the right upper extremity since the mastectomy. Her only medication is simvastatin. She lives in an assisted living facility. She is content with her living arrangement but feels guilty that she is dependent on others. Vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination shows extensive edema of the right arm. Skin exam of the proximal upper right extremity shows three coalescing, 0.5–1.0 cm heterogeneous, purple-colored plaques with associated ulceration.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a purple area on my right arm that has been getting bigger for the last month.
Have you experienced any trauma to your right arm recently?
No, I have not had any trauma to my right arm recently.
Does the purple area on your arm hurt or itch?
The purple area on my right arm does not hurt or itch.
Is the purple area raised or is it flat with your skin surface?
The purple area on my arm is raised with some parts that look like open sores.
Have you noticed any bleeding or oozing from the open sores?
No, I haven't noticed any bleeding or oozing from the open sores.
Are there any similar lesions on other parts of your body?
No, there are no similar lesions on other parts of my body.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin cancer or other skin conditions?
Yes, I had basal cell carcinoma treated with surgery 2 years ago.
Have you noticed any changes in your overall health, such as weight loss, fever, or night sweats?
No, I haven't noticed any changes like weight loss, fever, or night sweats.
Have you been exposed to any new medications, chemicals, or environmental factors that could cause skin reactions?
No, I haven't been exposed to any new medications, chemicals, or environmental factors that could cause skin reactions.
How old are you, and what is your sex?
I am a 93-year-old woman.
Do you have a history of vascular issues, like varicose veins or circulatory problems?
No, I don't have a history of vascular issues like varicose veins or circulatory problems, but I do have a long-term swelling problem in my right arm.
Final Diagnosis: Kaposi sarcoma
